Healthy.name: Preventive Care Program
Healthy.application: Apply organic compost monthly, use beneficial bacteria, maintain proper mulching

Leaf Blight.name: Neem Oil Treatment
Leaf Blight.application: Mix 2 tablespoons neem oil + 1 tsp soap per liter water. Spray in evening to avoid leaf burn.

Leaf Blight.name: Baking Soda Fungicide
Leaf Blight.application: 1 tsp baking soda + 1 tsp oil + few drops soap per liter water. Test on small area first.

Leaf Blight.name: Copper Soap Fungicide
Leaf Blight.application: Follow manufacturer's organic certification guidelines. Apply before rain.

Powdery Mildew.name: Milk Spray Solution
Powdery Mildew.application: Mix 1 part milk with 9 parts water. Spray in morning, avoid hot sun. Proteins create hostile environment for fungi.

Powdery Mildew.name: Garlic-Onion Antifungal
Powdery Mildew.application: Blend 6 cloves garlic + 1 onion in 1L water. Strain, add soap, spray affected areas.

Powdery Mildew.name: Potassium Bicarbonate
Powdery Mildew.application: 1 tablespoon per liter water + few drops oil. More effective than baking soda.

Rust Disease.name: Compost Tea Biofungicide
Rust Disease.application: Steep 1 cup compost in 4L water for 24-48 hours with 1 tsp molasses. Strain and spray.

Rust Disease.name: Chamomile Antifungal Tea
Rust Disease.application: Steep 2 tbsp dried chamomile in 1L hot water for 20 minutes. Cool, strain, spray affected areas.

Rust Disease.name: Bordeaux Mixture (Organic)
Rust Disease.application: Mix equal parts copper sulfate and lime in water. Use only organic-approved formulations.

Bacterial Spot.name: Hydrogen Peroxide Disinfectant
Bacterial Spot.application: Dilute 1 part 3% H2O2 with 10 parts water. Spray lightly, avoid overuse on sensitive plants.

Bacterial Spot.name: Apple Cider Vinegar Treatment
Bacterial Spot.application: 2 tablespoons ACV per liter water. Spray in early morning. Creates hostile environment for bacteria.

Bacterial Spot.name: Beneficial Bacteria Inoculation
Bacterial Spot.application: Apply beneficial bacteria to soil and root zone. They outcompete harmful bacteria.

Mosaic Virus.name: Infected Plant Removal
Mosaic Virus.application: Remove entire infected plants. Disinfect tools between each plant. Dispose in municipal waste, not compost.

Mosaic Virus.name: Reflective Mulch Barrier
Mosaic Virus.application: Install reflective mulch around plants. Confuses aphids that transmit virus.

Mosaic Virus.name: Companion Planting Defense
Mosaic Virus.application: Plant deterrent species in and around susceptible crops. Creates natural pest barriers.
